Package org.blab.utils

Class RingBuffer<T>

java.lang.Object
org.blab.utils.RingBuffer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of persisted elements.
public class RingBuffer<T> extends Object
Blocking buffer with fixed circular storage.

    Create new buffer with specified capacity.

  • Constructor Details

    • RingBuffer

      public RingBuffer(int capacity)
      Create new buffer with specified capacity.

  • Method Details

    • size

      public int size()

    • capacity

      public int capacity()

    • put

      public void put(T e)
      Append an element to the end of the buffer.

      If the buffer size is equal to capacity, the oldest element will be overwritten.

      Parameters:
      e - element to append.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if provided element is null.

    • put

      public void put(List<T> es)
      Append elements to the end of the buffer.

      If the buffer size is equal to capacity, the oldest element will be overwritten.

      Parameters:
      es - elements to append.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if provided list is null.

    • peek

      public Optional<T> peek()
      Retrieve but does not remove the last element.
      Returns:
      The last element, if exists.

    • poll

      public Optional<T> poll()
      Retrieve and remove the last element. The Optional is empty if the buffer is empty.
      Returns:
      The last element, if exists.

    • pollOldest

      public Optional<T> pollOldest()
      Retrieve and remove the oldest element. The Optional is empty if the buffer is empty.
      Returns:
      The oldest element, if exists.

    • poll

      public T poll(long timeout) throws InterruptedException, TimeoutException
      Retrieve and remove the last element.

      If the buffer is empty, waits for specified timeout.

      A negative timeout is treated as infinity.

      Parameters:
      timeout - timeout in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      The last element if it appears within the specified timeout.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if thread interrupted during timeout.
      TimeoutException - if timeout expired but buffer is still empty.

    • pollOldest

      public T pollOldest(long timeout) throws InterruptedException, TimeoutException
      Retrieve and remove the oldest element.

      If the buffer is empty, waits for specified timeout.

      A negative timeout is treated as infinity.

      Parameters:
      timeout - timeout in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      The oldest element if it appears within the specified timeout.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if thread interrupted during timeout.
      TimeoutException - if timeout expired but buffer is still empty.

    • pollAvailable

      public List<T> pollAvailable()
      Retrieve and remove all available elements.
      Returns:
      all elements since last poll.

    • pollExactly

      public Optional<List<T>> pollExactly(int n)
      Retrieve and remove last c elements. The Optional is empty if there are not enough elements.
      Returns:
      Last c elements, if exists.

    • pollExactly

      public List<T> pollExactly(int n, long timeout) throws TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Retrieve and remove last c elements.

      If the buffer is empty, waits for specified timeout.

      Negative timeout treated as infinity.

      Parameters:
      timeout - timeout in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      The last c elements if they are appears within the specified timeout.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if thread interrupted during timeout.
      TimeoutException - if timeout expired but there are still not enough elements.

    • pollAtLeast

      public List<T> pollAtLeast(int n, long timeout) throws TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Retrieve and remove all elements, but at least c.

      If there are not enough elements, waits for specified timeout.

      Negative timeout treated as infinity.

      Parameters:
      timeout - timeout in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      The last c elements if they are appears within the specified timeout.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if thread interrupted during timeout.
      TimeoutException - if timeout expired but there are still not enough elements.
